item.title: [Resolved] RapidEars + RuleORama
item.dc:creator: adb
item.description:
I get a very quick response in rapidEarsDidReceiveLiveSpeechHypothesis but it is not quickly reporting a final hypothesis in rapidEarsDidReceiveFinishedSpeechHypothesis. This is also using RuleORama 2.0 which I didn’t see anything had changed. Also, the RuleORama page doesn’t have the OE additions to the instructions (just a heads up).

2014-12-09 16:23:27.504 App[2322:685824] Pocketsphinx has detected speech.
2014-12-09 16:23:30.851 App[2322:685824] rapidEarsDidReceiveLiveSpeechHypothesis: TEST
2014-12-09 16:23:53.001 App[2322:685824] Pocketsphinx has detected a second of silence, concluding an utterance.
2014-12-09 16:23:53.868 App[2322:685824] rapidEarsDidReceiveFinishedSpeechHypothesis: TEST
2014-12-09 16:23:53.868 App[2322:685824] TEST HEARD

This took 23 seconds to return. Any thoughts on this?

item.title: Reply To: [Resolved] RapidEars + RuleORama
item.dc:creator: adb
item.description: Actually, I didn’t notice but I see what is happening. It is just listening in rapidEarsDidReceiveLiveSpeechHypothesis: and not returning in rapidEarsDidReceiveFinishedSpeechHypothesis on my silence. I didn’t see anything that could be directly set to affect this. VAD settings didn’t make any difference.

item.title: Reply To: [Resolved] RapidEars + RuleORama
item.dc:creator: Halle Winkler
item.description: The first thing I would check here is to make sure you really replaced the acoustic model when you went through the upgrade process. If that doesn’t help, can you turn on OELogging and setVerboseRapidEars:TRUE and show the output? And please show your RapidEars settings.

item.title: Reply To: [Resolved] RapidEars + RuleORama
item.dc:creator: adb
item.description: Not sure which one was the culprit but I removed all of the new frameworks files and re-imported them. Everything seems to be in order after some sleep. Carry on nothing to see here. =)

item.title: Reply To: [Resolved] RapidEars + RuleORama
item.dc:creator: Halle Winkler
item.description: My favorite kind of fix :) . Glad it’s working.

item.title: Reply To: [Resolved] RapidEars + RuleORama
item.dc:creator: Halle Winkler
item.description: In case this has returned, OpenEars 2.01 and RapidEars 2.01 out now have a fix for similar symptoms.
